definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
to get married soon after meeting

sentences.english: A big thunder, lightning a good light, the wind is also very fierce.
sentences.chinese: 雷声好大，闪电好亮，风也很猛。

sentences.english: The magician riffled through the cards with skilful fingers that moved like lightning.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师用熟练的手指闪电般地洗牌。

sentences.english: Fixed Lightning Fury to do initial weapon damage.
sentences.chinese: 确实用缩写名签武器损坏固定的闪电暴怒。

sentences.english: Internet dating, speed dating and dating agencies are all very popular nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 网恋，闪电恋，婚介所在现今都很流行。

sentences.english: Penny's hair from BOLT is simulated using a clumping technique.
sentences.chinese: 《闪电狗》中潘妮的头发是采用聚集技术模拟出来的。

sentences.english: He careened through foreign territories on a desperate kind of blitz.
sentences.chinese: 在孤注一掷地闪电战中他猛冲过外国领地。

sentences.english: The sky rains and lightnings, they are scared and run immediately.
sentences.chinese: 天空立即落起大雨，而且行雷闪电，大伙儿立即。

sentences.english: But positively-charged lightning also occurs, most often in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 但是拥有正电荷的闪电同样存在，大多出现在冬季。

sentences.english: My name is Lightning Bolt, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 我的名字是闪电博尔特。

sentences.english: Lightning rod array above the underground Kiva on South Baldy Peak.
sentences.chinese: 闪电上空南博尔迪山山顶地下Kiva棒阵列。

sentences.english: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow
sentences.chinese: 他的像貌如同闪电，衣服洁白如雪。
闪电和雷声逐渐地减小了。

sentences.english: Many have been struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 许多建筑被闪电击中烧毁于地，另一些被军阀烧毁。

sentences.english: In case of lightning, please stop play and take shelter immediately.
sentences.chinese: 如遇打雷闪电，请立即停止打球，到安全区暂避。

sentences.english: The lightning zigzagged through the church yard.
sentences.chinese: 闪电呈之字形划过教堂的院子。

definition: lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
be high up in the sky
